learningPaths.title: Popular Programming Languages
learningPaths.description: Overview of the most commonly used programming languages.

learningPaths.title: Scripting Languages
learningPaths.description: Languages often used for automating tasks, web development, and rapid prototyping.

learningPaths.title: Object-Oriented Languages
learningPaths.description: Languages that follow the object-oriented programming paradigm, using classes and objects to structure programs.

learningPaths.title: Functional Languages
learningPaths.description: Languages that emphasize functional programming paradigms, focusing on immutability and pure functions.

learningPaths.title: Assembly Languages
learningPaths.description: Low-level programming languages that are closely tied to machine architecture and hardware instructions.

learningPaths.title: Data Science and Statistical Languages
learningPaths.description: Languages used for data manipulation, analysis, and statistical computing.

learningPaths.title: Esoteric Languages
learningPaths.description: Programming languages created as jokes, for experimentation, or for specialized applications, often with obscure syntax.

learningPaths.title: Code-Golf Languages
learningPaths.description: Languages designed for solving problems with the fewest number of characters possible, often used in code-golf challenges.

learningPaths.title: SQL and Database Languages
learningPaths.description: Languages used to manage and query databases, including SQL variants.

learningPaths.title: Hardware Description Languages
learningPaths.description: Languages used to describe the behavior and structure of electronic circuits, primarily for simulation and design.

learningPaths.title: Procedural Languages
learningPaths.description: Languages that follow the procedural programming paradigm, emphasizing a step-by-step approach to problem-solving.

learningPaths.title: Logical and Constraint Programming Languages
learningPaths.description: Languages that are based on formal logic and are used for solving constraint satisfaction problems.

learningPaths.title: Miscellaneous or Novel Languages
learningPaths.description: Languages with unique or experimental features, used for niche applications or exploration.
